song.title: Danny Boy
song.author: Test Songbook
song.songtext:
This is an unlabeled verse.
Intro [G7 C C7 F]
1. [A7]Oh Danny [D]Boy, the pipes, the [D7]pipes are [G]calling From glen to [D]glen, and [F#m]down the [G]mountain [A7]side The summer’s [D]gone, and all the [D7]flowers are [G]dying ‘Tis you, ’tis [D] you must [Em]go and [A7]I must [D]bide.
R1: [6b7]But come ye [7bm]back when [4#]summer’s [6b7]in the [1#]meadow Or when the [7bm]valley’s [4#]hushed and [4m]white with [3b7]snow [6b7] ‘Tis I’ll be [1#]here in [4#] sunshine or in [1#]sha[7bm]dow. Oh Danny [1#]Boy, oh Danny [4#]Boy, I [6b7]love you [1#]so.
Second verse
And if you come, when all the flowers are dying And I am dead, As dead I well may be You’ll come and find The place where I am lying And kneel and say an ”Ave” there for me.
R2: And I shall hear, though soft you tread above me And all my dreams will warm and sweeter be
If you’ll not fail to tell me that you love me I’ll sleep in peace until you come to me.
